unnormalised: Hey everyone, just saw a news update on the dengue situation in Delhi. Seems like cases are spiking up, especially in areas like Rohini and Karol Bagh. The MCD is advising everyone to be extra careful and prevent water from stagnating. Apparently, dengue fever is caused by the bite of an infected Aedes mosquito.
normalised: Hey everyone, just saw a news update on the dengue situation in Delhi. Seems like cases are spiking up, especially in areas like Rohini and Karol Bagh. The M-C-D is advising everyone to be extra careful and prevent water from stagnating. Apparently, dengue fever is caused by the bite of an infected Aedes mosquito.

unnormalised: According to the report, there've been like, 250+ cases reported this month alone. Doctors at AIIMS are saying the symptoms to watch out for are high fever, severe headache, and joint pain. They're recommending consulting a Dr. immediately if you experience any of these. Seems like preventive measures are key!
normalised: According to the report, there've been like, two hundred and fifty plus cases reported this month alone. Doctors at A-I-I-M-S are saying the symptoms to watch out for are high fever, severe headache, and joint pain. They're recommending consulting a Doctor immediately if you experience any of these. Seems like preventive measures are key!

unnormalised: The Health Ministry is also running awareness campaigns, especially targeting slum areas where water logging is more common. They're distributing pamphlets with info about preventing mosquito breeding and using mosquito repellents. Someone mentioned on Twitter that the govt should also consider fogging more frequently.
normalised: The Health Ministry is also running awareness campaigns, especially targeting slum areas where water logging is more common. They're distributing pamphlets with info about preventing mosquito breeding and using mosquito repellents. Someone mentioned on Twitter that the government should also consider fogging more frequently.

unnormalised: Anyways, just wanted to share this info so everyone can be a bit more careful. Stay safe, guys, and remember to clear out any stagnant water around your homes! Let's try to keep the numbers down this monsoon season.
normalised: Anyways, just wanted to share this info so everyone can be a bit more careful. Stay safe, guys, and remember to clear out any stagnant water around your homes! Let's try to keep the numbers down this monsoon season.
